SENT.plain: Anoctaminopathy is a new muscular dystrophy caused by mutations in the ANO5 gene
ANO5 mutations cause distal and proximal phenotypes
We report here a follow-up muscle MRI study on five patients affected by distal form of anoctaminopathy

T1 weighted scans showed subsequent involvement of gastrocnemius medialis and soleus, hip adductors, hamstrings, gastrocnemius lateralis and quadriceps muscles, and later on tensor fascia lata, gluteus minimus and biceps brachii muscles, respectively
The STIR weighted images showed in the early stages widely distributed hyperintense signals, myoedema, in the adductors, hamstrings, and quadriceps muscles, which at that time have normal T1 signals
All patients showed asymmetry of muscle involvement both clinically and on muscle imaging
The progression of muscle involvement was relatively slow

We conclude that the pattern of muscle involvement seen in patients with distal myopathy with anoctamin 5 mutations (MMD3) is typical and can thus be useful during the differential diagnosis process allowing for a more targeted molecular approach
